alert.note: Alert for Broome; Chemung; Delaware; Sullivan; Tioga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 6:52PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF CHEMUNG...TIOGA...BROOME... SULLIVAN...DELAWARE...SUSQUEHANNA...NORTHERN WAYNE...AND BRADFORD COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of 30 MPH and greater can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. Brief periods of heavy snow can be expected as the squall moves through the area. Blowing snow can also quickly limit visibility. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 651 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from 7 miles east of Fleischmanns to near Corbett to near Sherman to near Apalachin to near Elmira and moving southeast at 35 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Rockland, Binghamton, Vestal, Johnson City, Endicott, Fallsburg, Barton, Monticello, Horseheads and Kirkwood. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 near 1. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 62 and 69, and between 79 and 109. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 217 and 230. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
